newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS energy markets thin after glitch.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS energy markets thin after glitch.

text.p: U.S. energy futures prices were unchanged on Wednesday's ACCESS session, dampened after a technical problem forced the computerized market to halt trade from 1630 EDT/2330 GMT to 1910 EDT/0210 GMT, traders said.
Traders said ACCESS computers lost links to news service pricing databases and were shut.
"We've been open for an hour-and-a-half and not a lot has happened," one traders said at 2030 EDT.
Crude oil for June delivery on NYMEX traded at $19.63 around that time, up one cent a barrel from the daytime close of $19.62.
The technical problem thinned crude oil trade to a very light 240 lots for June and 375 total.
After-hours, NYMEX June heating oil rose 0.12 cents a gallon to 53.20 cents, as 29 lots changed hands in the front month and 30 in all months, traders said.
NYMEX June unleaded gasoline futures eased 0.02 cents a gallon to 60.90 cents as 19 lots traded in June and 20 total.
